original_content:
A glimpse at a high-end radio set, for 1912. (Credit: [glasslinger], YouTube)Doing electronics in the 1910s was rather rough, with the radio probably the pinnacle of hi-tech. Despite this, with some know-how and basic wood- and metal-working skills you could get pretty far with DIY-ing a radio set. As [glasslinger] demonstrates in a YouTube video, you can even build your own set with your own crafted tube-amplifier. With items like a hand-crafted resistor and capacitor  as well as tuning elements and period-correct point-to-point wiring  it definitely has that retro vibe to it.
Such DIY projects used to be very commonly featured in electronics magazine, even after the transistor came onto the scene by the 1950s. The fancier designs use a regenerative design, like this one by [Dick Whipple] which provides not only some background theory, but also the full schematic and how-to in case you feel like giving it a shake yourself.
Even if youre not into crafting your own basic electronic components, radios like these are a great introduction to a lot of RF theory and amplification basics.
title: 1912年の高級ラジオセットをDIY
body: 1912年の高級ラジオセットの一端を見る。電子工作は難しかったが、ラジオはハイテクの頂点だった。知識と基本的な木工や金属加工スキルで、DIYで自作のラジオセットが作れた。手作りの抵抗器やキャパシター、チューニング要素、点対点配線などが使われ、レトロな雰囲気を持っている。
titles: レトロなラジオセットを自作する方法
